contentfulPagePressRelease.title: TAMUQ to Receive Fall Applications Until March 1

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Texas A&M University at Qatar’s admissions for the fall 2018 semester for freshman will remain open through 1 March.

Interested students may visit the Texas A&M Engineering Building at the Education City campus and meet with the Office of Admissions. The admissions officers and advisers are available to meet students and explain application requirements and the admissions process every Sunday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Maha Ayyash, director of admissions at Texas A&M at Qatar, said, “I encourage students who are strong in academics and are capable of thriving in a university that offers world-renowned engineering programs to consider applying to Texas A&M University at Qatar.”

Texas A&M commands an international reputation as one of the world’s premier engineering programs, and Texas A&M at Qatar builds on that esteem. Students at Texas A&M at Qatar receive the same top-tier training as students enrolled at the main campus.

Texas A&M at Qatar offers training and advanced accredited programs in chemical engineering, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering and petroleum engineering that rank among the top American universities for education and research.

Prospective students — aware of the high demand for professional engineers worldwide — are interested in Texas A&M at Qatar’s world-recognized, premier engineering programs that develop exemplary engineering leaders through internationally respected undergraduate and graduate degree programs. The branch campus’s faculty are among the best in their fields, and students have access to a state-of-the-art engineering facilities and labs.

For inquiries and appointments, students can contact the Office of Admissions directly at +974.4423.0043 or visit the Texas A&M Engineering Building at Education City campus. Applications are available on the admissions website at www.exploretamuq.com

pageContext.title: TAMUQ to Receive Fall Applications Until March 1
